DataElement.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale Past Week Other Symptom 1 Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale (Pediatrics 7-10) How Bothered or Troubled 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A patient-rated instrument developed to provide multidimensional information about a diverse group of common symptoms. This 32-question, self-rated questionnaire evaluates the prevalence, characteristics, and distress associated with each of the symptoms.The most recent week, including today.A question about an individual's distress from the first of their other symptoms.Numeric scores from 1 (Not at all) to 4 (Very much) on a Likert scale used on the Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale (Pediatrics 7-12) questionnaire.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale Past Week Other Symptom 1
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A patient-rated instrument developed to provide multidimensional information about a diverse group of common symptoms. This 32-question, self-rated questionnaire evaluates the prevalence, characteristics, and distress associated with each of the symptoms._The most recent week, including today._A question about an individual's distress from the first of their other symptoms.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A patient-rated instrument developed to provide multidimensional information about a diverse group of common symptoms. This 32-question, self-rated questionnaire evaluates the prevalence, characteristics, and distress associated with each of the symptoms.

Concepts.definition: A patient-rated instrument developed to provide multidimensional information about a diverse group of common symptoms. This 32-question, self-rated questionnaire evaluates the prevalence, characteristics, and distress associated with each of the symptoms.

Property.preferredName: Past Week How Much Distress Other Symptom 1
Property.preferredDefinition: The most recent week, including today.:A question about an individual's distress from the first of their other symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.
A question about an individual's distress from the first of their other symptoms.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: MSAS:Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale. Portenoy, RK, et.al. Eur J Cancer. 1994;30A(9):1326-36.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale (Pediatrics 7-10) How Bothered or Troubled 4 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 1 (Not at all) to 4 (Very much) on a Likert scale used on the Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale (Pediatrics 7-12) questionnaire.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something is or was of a moderate amount, intensity, or duration.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something is or was of a moderate amount, intensity, or duration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of strong agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a great amount or extent.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueDomain.origin: MSAS 7-10: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale (7-10). J. Collins, et al. Journal of Pain and Symptom Management. 2002 Jan; 23(1): 10-16

ReferenceDocuments.description: How much did this bother you or trouble you?
